results.title: Children of Hong Kong
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of a young boy Ying Kit, and his extended family in Hong Kong. The family live in a houseboat and the program looks at various aspects of his life such as school, family relationships, chores and food.

results.title: Children of change
results.creator_credit: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Irving Jacoby and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: This film shows the Day Care Centres as developed in Philadelphia where the children of working mothers are looked after. A trained social worker interviews parents and co-ordinates the activities of the centre with those of the home. Provision is made for older children after school hours. Some young children are placed with selected private families. Discusses reasons why women go out to work.

results.title: Children of Brunei
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson, Gibson Film Productions and Radio Television Brunei
results.brief_description: The film shows the life of two children in Brunei at school, reading the Koran, working at the markets, fishing and attending a wedding procession, emphasising the Muslim observance of religious ceremonies. Brunei is one of the last remaining monarchies in the world. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Children at play
results.creator_credit: Dentsu Tokyo and Koga Productions and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Between their studies, children of all ages and in all parts of Japan have time for fun and frolics. This film shows the games children play: on stilts, with hoops, in the snow, wrestling, ball games and shadow play and cats cradle. They also skip, play baseball, hopscotch, roller skating, shuttle cock, fly kites and model aeroplanes as well as painting, playing in sandpits, dressing dolls - and have a wonderful time in playgrounds.

results.title: Children (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part two of the series, “The Family of Man” which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. This programme shows the relationship between mothers and children, paternal influence and the use of mother substitutes, education and the preparation of children for adult life in traditional and modern settings in 1970.

results.title: Children's value judgements (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Seligman, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Explains the four basic categories (intuitive, heteronomous, expedient, and altruistic) into which the cognitive styles used in making moral judgements are divided. Children are interviewed and their responses are labelled with one of these categories. Includes discussion of the implications of the postulated categories. A second level course in Educational Studies introduced by Norman Williams.

results.title: Children's song games = Comptines
results.brief_description: Springtime means being outside. It means being able to play hopscotch, and sing songs, and play with bolo-bats. This film is about little girls celebrating spring in Montreal. They play in alley-ways, in doorways, in parks, and on the street. They sing songs that were sung by their parents and maybe their grandparents. Gibberish rhymes, counting songs, and old folk songs ring out in children’s voices. Without commentary, this short sketch travels the by-ways of Montreal where little girls play. Comptines is a French word for children’s song games.

results.title: Childhood sexual abuse: four case studies
results.creator_credit: Dale McCulley, Cavalcade Productions and MTI Teleprograms
results.brief_description: In a weekend workshop setting, four women relive their experiences of early sexual molestation. Each of the women reveals a uniquely poignant story.
